Material used.Description: Recombinant human α-synuclein (WT, A30P, A53T) proteins were provided by Dr. Peter T. Lansbury (Harvard University).

Readout description.Result Description: The binding constant for A30P is slightly lower (30% lower) than that of WT and A53T under the same conditions. A30P exhibits two types of binding to Cu(II), with a minor but strong binding site (10^10 M^-1) attributed to the binding to small oligomeric species.
The binding constants for Cu(II) to WT and A53T are similar, both ~2.4 × 10^9 and ~4.8 × 10^9 M^-1 at pH 7.2 and 7.4, respectively.

Biological replicates.Description: Two runs for each condition were performed, and the deviations of the fitted results were within 10%.

Basic positive control.Description: WT α-synuclein was used as a positive control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Nonlinear least-squares fit of the ITC data was used to determine the binding parameters.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Binding stoichiometry of 0.7-0.9:1 for all proteins studied.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Binding stoichiometry outside the range of 0.7-0.9:1.
